intro: Pentachaeta exilis subsp. exilis, commonly known as the slender pentachaeta, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and showy blooms. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, preferring well-drained soils and full sun exposure. Its slender stems and small, daisy-like flowers are adapted to withstand drought conditions. The subspecies exilis is distinguished by its more compact growth form and smaller flower size compared to other subspecies.
